David,

I think your right.  I have seen a redirection servlet which gets passed
a testid and url.  The testid is used to populate the MockBeans which is
then sent to the url (JSP).

--
Erik Meade             emeade@...
Senior Consultant      Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> -----Original Message-----
> From: dcorbin@...
> [mailto:dcorbin@...]On Behalf Of David Corbin
> Sent: Thursday, March 22, 2001 11:39 AM
> To: JUnit
> Subject: [junit] Unit Testing JSPs with Beans
>
>
> I'm anything but a JSP guru.  I'm looking at ways to invoke a JSP for
> testing (I know about J2EEUnit).  It seems to be that the <usebean> tag
> is likely to make it difficult to unitTest the JSP.  That is, what I
> want to make the beans be MockBeans.  Can anyone here make any useful
> comments about this?  Am I right?  Do you have a solution?
>
> Thanks.
> --
> David Corbin
> dcorbin@...
